Articles.Content: I rebalanced the N-1 and now it must not wobble.
Ok... it's quite huge. Might install it sometime, but I have tons of mods installed, currently. I'm quite sure that if I install this, I will get random crashes from time to time.

Think I am going to see if I can get the N-1 to push me to duna

Also In my video I installed the correct solar panels and one on the lander as it was running out of juice.

New update is very stable stage 1, but stage 2 it starts spinning.
Hm...time to mess with angular drag and braking force/torque?
If anyone is particularly interested in the history of the N-1 rocket, there is a very interesting documentary about it made by BBC:
Vostok release. Screenshots on the first page.
Is there any chance of this becoming independent on the Soviet Pack?

Well done on both mods MrTheBull, they really look brilliant.

Is there any chance of this becoming independent on the Soviet Pack?

That would require MrTheBull to create his own R7 rocket, Soyuz Spacecraft and Lunar Korabl.

Dude. I'll be plain and simple. Every time I see this thread, I pass by, thinking, oh, a place to launch rockets from orbit, etcetera, etetera, then I find out it's not that kind of mod. In fact, this mod is in no way related to the two words except by the craft of a rocket. Maybe you should rename it to something which it actually resembles, it might help.

Well done on both mods MrTheBull, they really look brilliant.

That would require MrTheBull to create his own R7 rocket, Soyuz Spacecraft and Lunar Korabl.

Not quiet, LK, and Soyuz, yeah, thats true...but about the R7...

http://www.astronautix.com/graphics/n/n319622.jpg

http://www.astronautix.com/graphics/n/n2.gif

(Dunno what MrTheBull thinks about this..will talk about it with him on Skype when he's online.

Was just reading some more on this...it's indeed possible to create N11 and rather easily. N11 would use a GR-1 1st stage as an upper stage, so if you make a proper GR-1, you only have to make stage 1 (reusable in N11) and 3 (which is a molniya 4th stage...use is kinda obvious,then), the 2nd one already exists...Soyuz Blok I(!)

For N111 I didnt find enough data...

http://www.astronautix.com/graphics/n/n319622.jpg

http://www.astronautix.com/graphics/n/n2.gif

Was just reading some more on this...it's indeed possible to create N11 and rather easily. N11 would use a GR-1 1st stage as an upper stage, so if you make a proper GR-1, you only have to make stage 1 (reusable in N11) and 3 (which is a molniya 4th stage...use is kinda obvious,then), the 2nd one already exists...Soyuz Blok I(!)

For N111 I didnt find enough data...

Good finds dimovski, I didn't know there were derivatives of the N1. I did some reading of my own and found out that the N11 was to be a replacement for the Proton family of rockets, and the N111 was to replace the Soyuz/Vostok family of rockets. None of them ever got off of the drawing board. I found some info about the N111 here, it looks like the N111 was a Blok V as the first stage, a Blok G as the second stage and the second stage of a R-9 (aka 8K77 Blok as the third stage.

Now that you've done the Vostok, could you also make the Voskhod spacecraft? It's very similar and would only need two additional parts (inflatable airlock and the retrorocket pack), plus a different IVA.

Good finds dimovski, I didn't know there were derivatives of the N1. None of them ever got off of the drawing board. Yep, found the N111 there too. Still not precise enough tho. If you need to change so much stuff on Blok V (from 4 to TWELVE engines if we trust astronautix), you do need some more precise parameters on the performance...cause all astronatuix has is enough for a guesstimation, not to actually model such a rocket.

EDIT:googled NK-19...

seems reasonably cheap for so much info

http://www.astro.gla.ac.uk/~hugh/techdetl/C_RocketEngRussia.html

maybe I'll find something somewhere else tho

Now that you've done the Vostok, could you also make the Voskhod spacecraft? It's very similar and would only need two additional parts (inflatable airlock and the retrorocket pack), plus a different IVA.

I would also vote for Voskhod. Now when we have Vostok and Soyuz and even TKS (not to mention Buran or Kliper), the Voskhod is the last Soviet manned spacecraft missing. And it looks awesome

I'd really like to see you take on some different Soyuz variations, Mr.TheBull. There are so many, you could have a lot of fun with them.
